meanings.definition: To waste time or money on unimportant things.
meanings.sent1: She kept frittering away her allowance on unnecessary toys.
meanings.sent2: Stop frittering your time on social media and focus on your studies.
meanings.sent3: He realized he was frittering his savings on useless gadgets.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were frittering away like sand slipping through her fingers.
meanings.sent5: The hours frittered by as she scrolled mindlessly through her phone.

meanings.definition: To break or tear into small pieces.
meanings.sent1: The dog was frittering the paper into shreds.
meanings.sent2: Careful not to fritter the delicate fabric while sewing.
meanings.sent3: The wind frittered the leaves into tiny fragments.
meanings.sent4: The old book was frittering apart from years of use.
meanings.sent5: She watched as the waves frittered the sand into fine grains.

meanings.definition: To move or act in a frivolous or aimless manner.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly was frittering from flower to flower in the garden.
meanings.sent2: He frittered around the room, not sure what to do next.
meanings.sent3: The children frittered about the playground, full of energy.
meanings.sent4: The dancer frittered gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent5: The leaves frittered down from the tree, dancing in the wind.
